chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: poset
P: sort T
x: ideal P

Goal:
ideal_leq x x

Premises:
ideal_leq = fun p1 p2 : ideal P => id_val p1 <== id_val p2 : ideal P -> ideal P -> Prop
Equality.sort = fun t : eqType => let (sort, _) := t in sort : eqType -> Type Equality.sort is a coercion
ideal : forall T : poset, T -> Type
Sub : forall x0 : ?T, ?P x0 -> ?sT where ?T : [T : poset P : T x : ideal P |- Type] ?P : [T : poset P : T x : ideal P |- pred ?T] ?sT : [T : poset P : T x : ideal P |- subType ?P]
Ideal : forall (T : poset) (P id_val : T), id_val <== P -> ideal P
id_val : forall (T : poset) (P : T), ideal P -> T
id_pf : forall (T : poset) (P : T) (i : ideal P), id_val i <== P
SubType : forall (sub_sort : Type) (val : sub_sort -> ?T) (Sub : forall x0 : ?T, ?P x0 -> sub_sort), (forall K : sub_sort -> Type, (forall (x0 : ?T) (Px : ?P x0), K (Sub x0 Px)) -> forall u : sub_sort, K u) -> (forall (x0 : ?T) (Px : ?P x0), val (Sub x0 Px) = x0) -> subType ?P where ?T : [T : poset P : T x : ideal P |- Type] ?P : [T : poset P : T x : ideal P |- pred ?T]
Poset.Pack : forall sort : Type, Poset.class_of sort -> Type -> poset
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : Equality.mixin_of sort } Arguments Equality.Pack [sort]%type_scope
relax : forall (T : poset) (P1 P2 : T), ideal P1 -> P1 <== P2 -> ideal P2
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
BinNums.positive_ind : forall P : BinNums.positive -> Prop, (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xI p)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xO p)) -> P BinNums.xH -> forall p : BinNums.positive, P p
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P n.+1) -> forall n : nat, P n
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Record subType (T : Type) (P : pred T) : Type := SubType { sub_sort : Type; val : sub_sort -> T; Sub : forall x : T, P x -> sub_sort; _ : forall K : sub_sort -> Type, (forall (x : T) (Px : P x), K (Sub x Px)) -> forall u : sub_sort, K u; _ : forall (x : T) (Px : P x), val (Sub x Px) = x } Arguments subType [T]%type_scope Arguments SubType {T}%type_scope {P} sub_sort%type_scope (val Sub rec SubK)%function_scope : rename
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : Poset.class_of sort; _ : Type } Arguments Poset.Pack [sort]%type_scope _ _%type_scope
Poset.sort = fun t : poset => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : poset -> Type Poset.sort is a coercion
SubSpec : forall (T : Type) (P : pred T) (sT : subType P) (x : T) (Px : P x), Sub_spec (Sub x Px)
sub_sort : forall (T : Type) (P : pred T), subType P -> Type
Variant Sub_spec (T : Type) (P : pred T) (sT : subType P) : sT -> Type := SubSpec : forall (x : T) (Px : P x), Sub_spec (Sub x Px) Arguments Sub_spec [T]%type_scope [P sT] Arguments SubSpec [T]%type_scope [P] _ [x]
@sval : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments Poset.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Poset.Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul...
poset_asym : forall (T : poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
sub_refl : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}), sub_leq x x
dfun_refl : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> poset) (x : forall x : A, B x), dfun_leq x x
poset_trans : forall (T : poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
poset_refl : forall (T : poset) (x : T), x <== x
pair_asym : forall (A B : poset) (x y : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y x -> x = y
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g
dfun_asym : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> poset) (x : forall x : A, B x) (y : forall x0 : A, B x0), dfun_leq x y -> dfun_leq y x -> x = y
